title.narrative: INCREASED CAPACITY OF SERVICE PROVIDERSTO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICES

description.narrative: Service providers have increased capacity to deliver quality and integrated health, HIV, nutrition, education, sanitation and child protection (including birth registration) services

mailing-address.narrative: D.34 Rue Lucien Fourneau Boite Postale 2110 Brazzaville

sector.narrative: Integrating ECD in emergency preparedness and response
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Technical assistance - Immunization (excluding Polio technical assistance)
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition
WASH in emergencies - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) response including menstrual hygiene management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Service providers have increased capacity to deliver quality and integrated health, HIV, nutrition, education, sanitation and child protection (including birth registration) services
Number of people living in water safe communities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Community Health Workers trained to implement integrated community case management (% of actually trained against the planned)
Number of stockouts of ORS at the national level
Percentage of districts implementing at least 3 interventions to improve the quality of maternal and newborn care at primary health care level
Percentage of health facilities that provide PMTCT/health facilities targeted
Percentage of health facilities that provide paediatric ART
Percentage of districts that are implementing at least 3 high impact adolescent prevention interventions
Designated BEmONC facilities that are operational on a 24/7 basis
Number of additional people living in the newly certified Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities as a result of UNICEF CATS programming during the year of reporting
Percentage of health facilities that provide treatment services for the management of SAM
Children 0-59 months vaccinated with polio through a UNICEF-supported programme during campaigns
Country had no stock-out of DTP/Penta, Polio (OPV and IPV) and Tetanus Toxoid vaccines at district level
An analysis of sex-disaggregated infant and child mortality estimates is produced
